snippet: The investigation of The Wall Street Journal coincides with a broader search the government is conducting of News Corporation over a phone-hacking scandal in 2011.
abstract: Wall Street Journal reports that government inquiry into phone hacking scandal at News Corporation, its owner, expanded in 2012 when Justice Department investigated claims that Journal employees in China bribed local officials with gifts in exchange for information; Journal claims its internal investigation revealed no evidence of wrongdoing.

byline.contributor: Michael Schmidt and William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The investigation of The Wall Street Journal coincides with a broader search the government is conducting of News Corporation over a phone-hacking scandal in 2011.

headline.seo: U.S. Looked at Bribery Claims Involving Wall Street Journal
headline.main: U.S. Looked at Wall Street Journal Over Claims of Bribery
headline.print_headline: U.S. Looked At Journal Over Claims Of Bribery

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
